RMIGameOfNim

Class GameLogicEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • RMIGameOfNim.GameLogicEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameLogicEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Core logic for the Game of Nim Keeps track of the total marbles for the game, the current count of marbles, a list of the comlpeted moves for debugging or error tracking

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameLogicEngine(int matchID, GameServer myServer, int playerOneID, boolean hard, boolean cpu)
      Use this constructor when creating a new GameLogicEngine (match) and assign the first player and choose the mode A second player must be assigned before one may start the game
      GameLogicEngine(int matchID, GameServer myServer, int playerOneID, int playerTwoID)
      Deprecated. 
      Default constructor, defaulting to a value of 20 for totalMarbles
      GameLogicEngine(int matchID, GameServer myServer, int playerOneID, int playerTwoID, boolean hard)
      Constructor specific to the requirements of the coursework: If hard is chosen a random integer between 2 and 100 will be chosen for totalMarbles.
      GameLogicEngine(int matchID, GameServer myServer, int playerOneID, int playerTwoID, int amount)
      Initialises the logic engine with a set amount of marbles Make sure you choose a positive integer above 2 or it will default to 20

        public GameLogicEngine(int matchID,
               GameServer myServer,
               int playerOneID,
               int playerTwoID,
               boolean hard)
        Constructor specific to the requirements of the coursework: If hard is chosen a random integer between 2 and 100 will be chosen for totalMarbles. Otherwise the game defaults to an integer value between 2 and 20 for totalMarbles.

        matchID -
        myServer -
        playerOneID -
        playerTwoID -

      • GameLogicEngine

               GameServer myServer,
               int playerOneID,
               int playerTwoID,

        playerOneID -
        playerTwoID -
        amount - Chosen amount of total marbles for the game

    • Method Detail

      • resetGameLogicEngine

        public void resetGameLogicEngine(boolean hard)
        Deprecated. Do not use, instantitate a new GameLogicEngine instead!
        Reset the GameLogicEngine without having to destroy the object and construct a new one. Makes a call to initialiseCoreGame()
        Parameters:
        hard - Boolean to choose hard mode (true) or normal mode (false)

      • pickMarbles

        public boolean pickMarbles(int playerID,
                  int amount)
        Lets a player, defined by the playerID, pick an amount of marbles. First determines if the chosen amount is a legal move and then if the playerID matches with the player who is up next
        Parameters:
        playerID -
        amount -
        Returns:
